page.title: 021ST. DEVELOPMENT,SKELMORLIE
page.content: Skelmorlie has developed in 3 dis- tinct phases,each phase having added to the present character of our com- munity. The 1st phase of development took place between 1840-1900 when rich Victorians and Edwardians decided to build{summer}homes along the Clyde. They built red sandstone mansions with servants wings and coach-houses. The family,friends and servants would move down for the whole summer.With the opening of the Hydropathic Establishment,Skelmorlie became a fashionable resort. The two World Wars put an end to the rich leisured life and the houses were too large for 1 family.The biggest of the houses became convalescent homes, hotels and church holiday centres, while the smaller houses were converted into flats.
